{
 "cells": [
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "ea635dab-2c7f-40e5-b24e-f2ca9ae00de8",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Quickstart example\n",
    "\n",
    "In the following example, we use the \"test\" MRIO of the pymrio module,\n",
    "which doesn't require to load additional data and has a low number of sectors and\n",
    "regions, allowing fast computation."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "id": "a4f4ad0b-7db2-4b74-b10a-5fd1ce9eb188",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<Axes: xlabel='step'>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 1,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# import pymrio for the test MRIO\n",
    "import pymrio\n",
    "\n",
    "# import pandas for the plot\n",
    "import pandas as pd\n",
    "\n",
    "# import the different classes\n",
    "from boario.simulation import Simulation  # Simulation wraps the model\n",
    "from boario.extended_models import ARIOPsiModel  # The core of the model\n",
    "\n",
    "from boario.event import EventKapitalRebuild  # A class defining a shock on capital\n",
    "\n",
    "# Load the IOSystem from pymrio\n",
    "mrio = pymrio.load_test().calc_all()\n",
    "\n",
    "# Instantiate the model and the simulation\n",
    "model = ARIOPsiModel(mrio)\n",
    "sim = Simulation(model,n_temporal_units_to_sim=730)\n",
    "\n",
    "# Instantiate an event.\n",
    "ev = EventKapitalRebuild.from_scalar_regions_sectors(\n",
    "  impact=500000,\n",
    "  regions=[\"reg1\"],\n",
    "  sectors=[\"manufactoring\", \"mining\"],\n",
    "  impact_sectoral_distrib = \"gdp\",\n",
    "  rebuilding_sectors={\"construction\": 0.55,\"manufactoring\": 0.45},\n",
    "  rebuilding_factor=1.0,\n",
    "  rebuild_tau=90,\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Add the event to the simulation\n",
    "sim.add_event(ev)\n",
    "\n",
    "# Launch the simulation\n",
    "sim.loop(progress=False)\n",
    "\n",
    "# You should be able to generate a dataframe of\n",
    "# the production with the following line\n",
    "df = sim.production_realised\n",
    "# This allows to normalize production at its initial level\n",
    "df = df / df.loc[0]\n",
    "\n",
    "df.loc[:, (\"reg1\", slice(None))].plot()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": null,
   "id": "57840988",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": []
  }
 ],
